chat.title: antiemetics
chat.message:
- any way to just show each med once and have drop down for route? instead of 4 rows for each med
- add SL antiemetics (ex. zofran)
- add haldol

chat.title: wrong heading
chat.message: - "subc antiemetics" group that has morphine and fentanyl in it. change label

chat.title: Yellow headings
chat.message: Just realized there's a drop down menu! Not sure if this is new (after mwahab's comment) or you always designed this way - I like it! Much easier on the eyes than rows on rows of drugs. I am unfortunately confused by the yellow headers - are they in the right spots? It's good to group the meds (again, guides clinical decision) but looks to be incomplete at the moment

chat.title: Acetaminophen
chat.message: We have Tylenol 500mg tabs in our hospital. I usually just write 500-1000mg PO QID PRN. Perhaps we can sub in an order like that as an alternative / addition to the 375mg multiples?
